Questions.Question: Who wrote the novel 'Pride and Prejudice'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Pride and Prejudice' was written by Jane Austen and published in 1813.

Questions.Question: Which book begins with the line 'It was the best of times, it was the worst of times'?
Questions.Explanation: The opening line 'It was the best of times, it was the worst of times' is from 'A Tale of Two Cities' by Charles Dickens.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of 'To Kill a Mockingbird'?
Questions.Explanation: 'To Kill a Mockingbird' was written by Harper Lee and published in 1960.

Questions.Question: Which author wrote the famous play 'Romeo and Juliet'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Romeo and Juliet' is a tragedy written by William Shakespeare in the late 16th century.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of the 'Harry Potter' series?
Questions.Explanation: The 'Harry Potter' series was written by J.K. Rowling and consists of seven fantasy novels.

Questions.Question: Which book begins with the line 'Call me Ishmael'?
Questions.Explanation: The opening line 'Call me Ishmael' is from the novel 'Moby-Dick' by Herman Melville.

Questions.Question: Who wrote the novel 'Jane Eyre'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Jane Eyre' was written by Charlotte Bronte and published in 1847.

Questions.Question: Which author wrote the famous play 'Hamlet'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Hamlet' is a tragedy written by William Shakespeare in the early 17th century.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of the 'Lord of the Rings' trilogy?
Questions.Explanation: The 'Lord of the Rings' trilogy was written by J.R.R. Tolkien and published between 1954 and 1955.

Questions.Question: Which book begins with the line 'It is a truth universally acknowledged'?
Questions.Explanation: The opening line 'It is a truth universally acknowledged' is from 'Pride and Prejudice' by Jane Austen.

Questions.Question: Who wrote the novel 'Wuthering Heights'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Wuthering Heights' was written by Emily Bronte and published in 1847.

Questions.Question: Which author wrote the famous play 'Macbeth'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Macbeth' is a tragedy written by William Shakespeare in the early 17th century.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of the 'Game of Thrones' series?
Questions.Explanation: The 'Game of Thrones' series, also known as 'A Song of Ice and Fire,' was written by George R.R. Martin.

Questions.Question: Which book begins with the line 'In a hole in the ground there lived a hobbit'?
Questions.Explanation: The opening line 'In a hole in the ground there lived a hobbit' is from 'The Hobbit' by J.R.R. Tolkien.

Questions.Question: Who wrote the novel '1984'?
Questions.Explanation: '1984' was written by George Orwell and published in 1949.

Questions.Question: Which author wrote the famous play 'The Importance of Being Earnest'?
Questions.Explanation: 'The Importance of Being Earnest' is a comedy play written by Oscar Wilde in 1895.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of the 'Chronicles of Narnia' series?
Questions.Explanation: The 'Chronicles of Narnia' series was written by C.S. Lewis and consists of seven fantasy novels.

Questions.Question: Which book begins with the line 'It was a bright cold day in April'?
Questions.Explanation: The opening line 'It was a bright cold day in April' is from the novel '1984' by George Orwell.

Questions.Question: Who wrote the novel 'The Great Gatsby'?
Questions.Explanation: 'The Great Gatsby' was written by F. Scott Fitzgerald and published in 1925.

Questions.Question: Which author wrote the famous play 'Romeo and Juliet'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Romeo and Juliet' is a tragedy written by William Shakespeare in the late 16th century.
